# addToSimulation()

**Instance Method**

Adds this joint to the simulation.

## Declaration

```swift
@discardableResult @MainActor func addToSimulation() throws -> Entity
```

## Return Value

The entity that owns the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent], which this joint has been added to.

## Discussion

This method looks for an ancestral [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity] that has [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent] by traversing upwards from the entity referenced by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJoint/pin0].

If found, it adds the joint to that ancestor’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent].

The traversal stops when reaching an [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity] with [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsSimulationComponent], or when it cannot traverse up anymore. In the former case it adds the joint to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent/joints]. In the latter case it adds [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent] to the first [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity] referenced by the joint, and adds the joint to the newly created [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsJointsComponent].
